intro: Tococa tetramera, commonly known as the Amazonian tea plant, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small white flowers. The plant is most notable for its leaves, which are used to produce a stimulating beverage similar to coffee. Tococa tetramera thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional Amazonian medicine and sustainable agriculture.
